Package io.dimeformat.crypto

Interface ICryptoSuite

public interface ICryptoSuite
An interface that classes need to implement to provide cryptographic services.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the name of the cryptographic suite, usually a short series of letters, i.e. STN for the standard Dime cryptography suite.
      Returns:
      Identifier of the cryptographic suite.

    • generateKeyName

      String generateKeyName​(Key key)
      Generates a unique name for a key. The generated name is not sensitive and may be distributed without compromising the key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to generate a name for.
      Returns:
      A unique name.

    • generateSignature

      byte[] generateSignature​(Item item, Key key) throws CryptographyException
      Generates a cryptographic signature from an item using the provided key.
      Parameters:
      item - The item that should be signed.
      key - The key to use when signing the data.
      Returns:
      The signature as a byte array.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If any cryptographic operations goes wrong.

    • verifySignature

      boolean verifySignature​(Item item, byte[] signature, Key key) throws CryptographyException
      Verifies a cryptographic signature for an item using the provided key.
      Parameters:
      item - The item that should be verified towards the signature.
      signature - The raw signature to verify, as a byte-array.
      key - The key to use when verifying the signature.
      Returns:
      True is verified successfully, false if not.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If any cryptographic operations goes wrong.

    • generateKey

      Key generateKey​(List<KeyCapability> capabilities) throws CryptographyException
      Generates a cryptographic key for the provided usage, if possible.
      Parameters:
      capabilities - The intended capabilities of the generated key, i.e. {#KeyCapability.SIGN}.
      Returns:
      The generated key.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If any cryptographic operations goes wrong.

    • generateSharedSecret

      Key generateSharedSecret​(Key clientKey, Key serverKey, List<KeyCapability> capabilities) throws CryptographyException
      Generates a shared secret from two keys or key pars. These keys must have {#KeyCapability.EXCHANGE} listed as a capability. The server/issuer of a key exchange is always the initiator and the client/audience is always the receiver (no matter on which side this method is called).
      Parameters:
      clientKey - The key or key pair from the client (usually the audience).
      serverKey - The key or key pair from the server (usually the issuer).
      capabilities - The intended capabilities of the generated key, i.e. {#KeyCapability.ENCRYPT}.
      Returns:
      The generated shared key.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If any cryptographic operations goes wrong.

    • encrypt

      byte[] encrypt​(byte[] data, Key key) throws CryptographyException
      Encrypts a plain text byte array using the provided key.
      Parameters:
      data - The byte array to encrypt.
      key - The key to use for the encryption.
      Returns:
      The encrypted cipher text as a byte array.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If any cryptographic operations goes wrong.

    • decrypt

      byte[] decrypt​(byte[] data, Key key) throws CryptographyException
      Decrypts a cipher text byte array using the provided key.
      Parameters:
      data - The byte array to decrypt.
      key - The key to use for the decryption.
      Returns:
      The plain text as a byte array.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If any cryptographic operations goes wrong.

    • generateHash

      String generateHash​(byte[] data) throws CryptographyException
      Generates a secure hash digest of the provided data.
      Parameters:
      data - The data that should be hashed.
      Returns:
      The hash digest of the provided data, encoded as a string.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If any cryptographic operations goes wrong.

    • encodeKeyBytes

      String encodeKeyBytes​(byte[] rawKey, Claim claim)
      Encodes a key from a byte-array to a string.
      Parameters:
      rawKey - The raw key byte-array to encode.
      claim - The name of the claim to encode the key for, should be Claim.KEY or Claim.PUB
      Returns:
      The encoded key.

    • decodeKeyBytes

      byte[] decodeKeyBytes​(String encodedKey, Claim claim)
      Decodes an encoded key to a byte array.
      Parameters:
      encodedKey - The encoded key.
      claim - The name of the claim to decode the key for, should be Claim.KEY or Claim.PUB
      Returns:
      The decoded key.
